publications.name: Tensor Decompositions for Signal Processing: Theory, Advances, and Applications
publications.summary: This comprehensive survey bridges theoretical advancements with practical applications in tensor decompositions, highlighting their role in multi-dimensional data analysis across signal processing and machine learning domains. It covers foundational models like CP and Tucker decompositions, explores advanced techniques such as tensor networks and Tensor Train, and discusses their applications in areas like source separation, feature extraction, and multi-view learning. The paper also addresses computational challenges and introduces strategies for scalable tensor recovery, offering insights into the future directions of tensor-based methodologies.

publications.name: Tensor Train Quantum State Tomography Using Compressed Sensing
publications.summary: This paper introduces a block-tensor train parameterization of the density matrix, making quantum state tomography more memory- and computationally efficient.

publications.name: A case study of spatiotemporal forecasting techniques for weather forecasting
publications.summary: This work presents a tensor train dynamic mode decomposition method for regional weather forecasting that captures spatiotemporal correlations while reducing computational costs and maintaining high accuracy without requiring training.

publications.name: Some contributions to Lagrangian modelling of Power Converters
publications.summary: This work extends Euler–Lagrange (energy-based) modelling to high-fidelity power converters by refining the modelling procedure, introducing a principled way to incorporate circuit constraints via variable labeling, and deriving accurate switched state-space models that account for non-idealities—demonstrated through examples like diode rectifiers and DC–DC boost converters.

publications.name: Tensor Train Completion of Multi-Way Data Observed Along One Mode
publications.summary: This paper introduces a non‑optimization-based method to complete an incomplete tensor under a fiber‑wise observation pattern—i.e., only whole mode‑N fibers are observed—by computing a Tensor‑Train decomposition using standard linear algebra (e.g., SVD/QR) on partially observed unfoldings. It provides deterministic uniqueness guarantees under structured sampling and demonstrates fast, accurate recovery in synthetic noisy high‑order tensors (e.g., 5th‑order) compared to TT‑WOPT and SiLRTC‑TT.

publications.name: Image Segmentation with Topological Priors
publications.summary: This work shows that incorporating topological priors into deep neural network training—specifically within a U-Net architecture—significantly enhances segmentation accuracy, particularly for fine-scale structures, as validated on the ISBI EM dataset using both standard metrics and Betti number-based topological correctness.
